intro: Boerlagiodendron mariannense, commonly known as the Marian Islands hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Central Pacific. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and it thrives in humid, coastal environments. Boerlagiodendron mariannense is often found growing on coastal cliffs and sandy soils in its native habitat.
